thread.title: Sports Roundup: UCA and Conway volleyball
thread.title_full: Sports Roundup: UCA and Conway volleyball

author: Staff
title: Sports Roundup: UCA and Conway volleyball
text:
Sports Roundup: UCA and Conway volleyball Posted: October 16, 2015 - 10:53pm LOG CABIN DEMOCRAT 
BEAUMONT, Texas – The University of Central Arkansas Sugar Bears (11-10, 7-2) handed Lamar (13-8, 3-4) its first home defeat in 10 matches Thursday night with a 25-23, 25-16, 25-16 victory. 
On the night, Central Arkansas hit .340 and had a trio of players that hit over that mark. Heather Schnars hit .415 with a match-high 20 kills, Megan Nash hit .350 with nine kills, and freshman Samantha Anderson hit .500 with eight kills. Amy South added 39 assists. 
Central Arkansas closes out the four-match current road trip on Saturday, traveling to Huntsville, Texas to take on Sam Houston State. CHS VOLLEYBALL 
Conway’s volleyball team (26-5, 112-3) had to come from behind Thursday night to defeat Mount St. Mary, 18-25, 25-23, 25-5, 23-25, 15-13. 
Aly Brinkley had 22 kills and six blocks. McKenzie Hart had 29 assists. Tori Popham added 11 digs. 
Conway (15-1, 13-0) won the JV match, 25-13, 25-21. McKinsie Shaw and Holly Stewart had six kills apiece. Aryn Blumenberg had 14 assists and two aces. Megan Solberg had 15 digs and Marlee Scaife added two blocks. 
The Lady Cats play their last conference match of the season Tuesday at Bryant.
